# 2. Define Prompt (MUST be quoted to handle spaces)
PROMPT="You are the 'Builder' agent for this repository.
You MUST:
- Obey prompts/AGENTS.md and prompts/builder.prompt.md in this workspace as if they were system instructions.
- Work ONLY inside the provided git worktree and do NOT touch any remotes.
Git and staging requirements (NON-NEGOTIABLE):
- After modifying files and running checks, you MUST prepare the Git state:
  - Run git add to stage ALL relevant files so that git diff main...HEAD reflects the full change.
  - If the environment allows Git commits, you SHOULD create a local commit with a clear, concise message (for example: feat: short summary (scope)).
  - If git commit is disallowed or fails, LEAVE all changes staged and clearly report the error.
- NEVER run git push or modify any remote.
- In your final handoff you MUST:
  - show git status --porcelain
  - if a commit was created, also show git log -1 --pretty=format:%s
Handoff and JSON requirements:
- Follow the 'Final handoff (MANDATORY format)' section from prompts/builder.prompt.md exactly, including READY_FOR_REVIEW as the last line.
- Write builder_result.json at the worktree root exactly as specified in prompts/builder.prompt.md (summary + complexity only).
Make minimal, focused changes that implement ONLY the requested task.
The user task is:
{{ $('Initialize Variables').item.json.body.prompt }}"
# 3. Execution
# We run the script from the main repo, but tell it to work (--cwd) in the worktree
nohup python3 "$RUNNER_SCRIPT" \
  --webhook "$RESUME_URL" \
  --cwd "$WORKTREE" \
  --cmd "opencode run --agent builder --title \"BUILDER {{ $('Initialize Variables').item.json.task_id }} {{ $('Initialize Variables').item.json.timeStamp }}\"  \"$PROMPT\"" \
  > /dev/null 2>&1 &

=# 1. Define paths (use absolute path for the runner script)
RUNNER_SCRIPT=".foreman/tools/agent_runner.py"
WORKTREE="{{ $('Initialize Variables').item.json.worktree_path }}"
RESUME_URL="{{ $execution.resumeUrl }}"
# 2. Define Prompt (MUST be quoted to handle spaces)
read -r -d '' PROMPT << 'EOF'
You are the 'Inspector' agent for this repository.
You MUST:
- Obey prompts/AGENTS.md and prompts/inspector.prompt.md in this workspace as if they were system instructions.
- Perform a read-only review of the changes in this git worktree.
- Base your review on:
  - the diff in inspector_diff.patch (if present),
  - the workspace code and tests,
  - the Builder's final handoff message content (per prompts/builder.prompt.md),
  - and the thin summary in builder_result.json (summary + complexity only).
Tooling and checks:
- For library or code changes, you SHOULD attempt to run the relevant checks yourself from the workspace root when the environment allows it:
  - pnpm lint
  - pnpm check
  - pnpm test (or at least a relevant subset such as pnpm test:unit)
  - pnpm prepack for packaging sanity when appropriate.
- Use the results of these checks to inform your decision:
  - If a check fails, include the failure and a brief summary of the command output in issues and recommend fixes as next_tasks.
  - If a check cannot be run (for example, missing tooling or environment restrictions), briefly note that in your reasoning and do NOT block solely because it could not be executed.
- Treat the Builder's reported commands (if any) as helpful context, but do NOT rely on them as the sole evidence that checks were run or passed.
Output contract (IMPORTANT):
- You MUST write a file named inspector_result.json at the root of this worktree.
- The file MUST contain EXACTLY one JSON object with this schema:
  {
    "status": "approved" | "changes_requested",
    "issues": [
      { "severity": "blocker" | "major" | "minor", "description": "...", "paths": ["..."] }
    ],
    "next_tasks": ["..."]
  }
- Treat builder_result.json as a lightweight summary ONLY. It is NOT required to repeat the full handoff.
- The Builder MAY optionally include a marker like READY_FOR_REVIEW in the final message to signal intent. You MUST NOT treat the presence or absence of this marker as a correctness requirement; base your review on the actual content of the handoff, the diff, the checks you run, and the workspace.
- You MAY print human-readable commentary to stdout, but Foreman will only read inspector_result.json.
Do NOT require the Builder to embed the full handoff into builder_result.json or to end messages with READY_FOR_REVIEW. Judge compliance by comparing:
- the diff and workspace,
- the content of the final handoff message,
- the results of any checks you run,
- and the rules in AGENTS.md and prompts/inspector.prompt.md.
Now review the current changes and write inspector_result.json accordingly.
EOF
# 3. Execution: run Inspector via agent_runner.py
nohup python3 "$RUNNER_SCRIPT" \
  --webhook "$RESUME_URL" \
  --cwd "$WORKTREE" \
  --cmd "opencode run --agent inspector --title \"INSEPCTOR {{ $('Initialize Variables').item.json.body.task_id }} {{ $('Initialize Variables').item.json.timeStamp }}\" \"$PROMPT\"" \
  > /dev/null 2>&1 &

=cd {{ $('Initialize Variables').first().json.worktree_path }} && \
    git push -u origin feature/{{ $('Initialize Variables').first().json.task_id }} && \
    gh pr create \
      --title "feat: {{ $('Initialize Variables').first().json.task_id }} implementation" \
      --body "{{ $json.summary || 'Automated PR by Foreman' }}" \
      --draft

= REPORT_FILE=".foreman/inspector/failures/{{ $('Initialize Variables').first().json.task_id }}_report.json"
    mkdir -p ./failures
    # Write the full inspector decision to the file
    echo '{{ JSON.stringify($json) }}' > "$REPORT_FILE"
